5227 
5228 /* -------------------- Alternative MORECORE functions ------------------- */
5229 
5230 /*
5231  Guidelines for creating a custom version of MORECORE:
5232 
5233  * For best performance, MORECORE should allocate in multiples of pagesize.
5234  * MORECORE may allocate more memory than requested. (Or even less,
5235  but this will usually result in a malloc failure.)
5236  * MORECORE must not allocate memory when given argument zero, but
5237  instead return one past the end address of memory from previous
5238  nonzero call.
5239  * For best performance, consecutive calls to MORECORE with positive
5240  arguments should return increasing addresses, indicating that
5241  space has been contiguously extended.
5242  * Even though consecutive calls to MORECORE need not return contiguous
5243  addresses, it must be OK for malloc'ed chunks to span multiple
5244  regions in those cases where they do happen to be contiguous.
5245  * MORECORE need not handle negative arguments -- it may instead
5246  just return MFAIL when given negative arguments.
5247  Negative arguments are always multiples of pagesize. MORECORE
5248  must not misinterpret negative args as large positive unsigned
5249  args. You can suppress all such calls from even occurring by defining
5250  MORECORE_CANNOT_TRIM,
5251 
5252  As an example alternative MORECORE, here is a custom allocator
5253  kindly contributed for pre-OSX macOS. It uses virtually but not
5254  necessarily physically contiguous non-paged memory (locked in,
5255  present and won't get swapped out). You can use it by uncommenting
5256  this section, adding some #includes, and setting up the appropriate
5257  defines above:
5258 
5259  #define MORECORE osMoreCore
5260 
5261  There is also a shutdown routine that should somehow be called for
5262  cleanup upon program exit.
5263 
5264  #define MAX_POOL_ENTRIES 100
5265  #define MINIMUM_MORECORE_SIZE (64 * 1024U)
5266  static int next_os_pool;
5267  void *our_os_pools[MAX_POOL_ENTRIES];
5268 
5269  void *osMoreCore(int size)
5270  {
5271  void *ptr = 0;
5272  static void *sbrk_top = 0;
5273 
5274  if (size > 0)
5275  {
5276  if (size < MINIMUM_MORECORE_SIZE)
5277  size = MINIMUM_MORECORE_SIZE;
5278  if (CurrentExecutionLevel() == kTaskLevel)
5279  ptr = PoolAllocateResident(size + RM_PAGE_SIZE, 0);
5280  if (ptr == 0)
5281  {
5282  return (void *) MFAIL;
5283  }
5284  // save ptrs so they can be freed during cleanup
5285  our_os_pools[next_os_pool] = ptr;
5286  next_os_pool++;
5287  ptr = (void *) ((((size_t) ptr) + RM_PAGE_MASK) & ~RM_PAGE_MASK);
5288  sbrk_top = (char *) ptr + size;
5289  return ptr;
5290  }
5291  else if (size < 0)
5292  {
5293  // we don't currently support shrink behavior
5294  return (void *) MFAIL;
5295  }
5296  else
5297  {
5298  return sbrk_top;
5299  }
5300  }
5301 
5302  // cleanup any allocated memory pools
5303  // called as last thing before shutting down driver
5304 
5305  void osCleanupMem(void)
5306  {
5307  void **ptr;
5308 
5309  for (ptr = our_os_pools; ptr < &our_os_pools[MAX_POOL_ENTRIES]; ptr++)
5310  if (*ptr)
5311  {
5312  PoolDeallocate(*ptr);
5313  *ptr = 0;
5314  }
5315  }
5316 
5317 */
5318

5408  * Use 'assert' rather than 'ASSERT' in WIN32 code to conform to
5409  usage of 'assert' in non-WIN32 code
5410  * Improve WIN32 'sbrk()' emulation's 'findRegion()' routine to
5411  avoid infinite loop
5412  * Always call 'fREe()' rather than 'free()'
5413 
5414  V2.6.5 Wed Jun 17 15:57:31 1998 Doug Lea (dl at gee)
5415  * Fixed ordering problem with boundary-stamping
5416 
5417  V2.6.3 Sun May 19 08:17:58 1996 Doug Lea (dl at gee)
5418  * Added pvalloc, as recommended by H.J. Liu
5419  * Added 64bit pointer support mainly from Wolfram Gloger
5420  * Added anonymously donated WIN32 sbrk emulation
5421  * Malloc, calloc, getpagesize: add optimizations from Raymond Nijssen
5422  * malloc_extend_top: fix mask error that caused wastage after
5423  foreign sbrks
5424  * Add linux mremap support code from HJ Liu
5425 
5426  V2.6.2 Tue Dec 5 06:52:55 1995 Doug Lea (dl at gee)
5427  * Integrated most documentation with the code.
5428  * Add support for mmap, with help from
5429  Wolfram Gloger (Gloger@lrz.uni-muenchen.de).
5430  * Use last_remainder in more cases.
5431  * Pack bins using idea from colin@nyx10.cs.du.edu
5432  * Use ordered bins instead of best-fit threshhold
5433  * Eliminate block-local decls to simplify tracing and debugging.
5434  * Support another case of realloc via move into top
5435  * Fix error occuring when initial sbrk_base not word-aligned.
5436  * Rely on page size for units instead of SBRK_UNIT to
5437  avoid surprises about sbrk alignment conventions.
5438  * Add mallinfo, mallopt. Thanks to Raymond Nijssen
5439  (raymond@es.ele.tue.nl) for the suggestion.
5440  * Add `pad' argument to malloc_trim and top_pad mallopt parameter.
5441  * More precautions for cases where other routines call sbrk,
5442  courtesy of Wolfram Gloger (Gloger@lrz.uni-muenchen.de).
5443  * Added macros etc., allowing use in linux libc from
5444  H.J. Lu (hjl@gnu.ai.mit.edu)
5445  * Inverted this history list
5446 
5447  V2.6.1 Sat Dec 2 14:10:57 1995 Doug Lea (dl at gee)
5448  * Re-tuned and fixed to behave more nicely with V2.6.0 changes.
5449  * Removed all preallocation code since under current scheme
5450  the work required to undo bad preallocations exceeds
5451  the work saved in good cases for most test programs.
5452  * No longer use return list or unconsolidated bins since
5453  no scheme using them consistently outperforms those that don't
5454  given above changes.
5455  * Use best fit for very large chunks to prevent some worst-cases.
5456  * Added some support for debugging
5457 
5458  V2.6.0 Sat Nov 4 07:05:23 1995 Doug Lea (dl at gee)
5459  * Removed footers when chunks are in use. Thanks to
5460  Paul Wilson (wilson@cs.texas.edu) for the suggestion.
5461 
5462  V2.5.4 Wed Nov 1 07:54:51 1995 Doug Lea (dl at gee)
5463  * Added malloc_trim, with help from Wolfram Gloger
5464  (wmglo@Dent.MED.Uni-Muenchen.DE).
5465 
5466  V2.5.3 Tue Apr 26 10:16:01 1994 Doug Lea (dl at g)
5467 
5468  V2.5.2 Tue Apr 5 16:20:40 1994 Doug Lea (dl at g)
5469  * realloc: try to expand in both directions
5470  * malloc: swap order of clean-bin strategy;
5471  * realloc: only conditionally expand backwards
5472  * Try not to scavenge used bins
5473  * Use bin counts as a guide to preallocation
5474  * Occasionally bin return list chunks in first scan
5475  * Add a few optimizations from colin@nyx10.cs.du.edu
5476 
5477  V2.5.1 Sat Aug 14 15:40:43 1993 Doug Lea (dl at g)
5478  * faster bin computation & slightly different binning
5479  * merged all consolidations to one part of malloc proper
5480  (eliminating old malloc_find_space & malloc_clean_bin)
5481  * Scan 2 returns chunks (not just 1)
5482  * Propagate failure in realloc if malloc returns 0
5483  * Add stuff to allow compilation on non-ANSI compilers
5484  from kpv@research.att.com
5485 
5486  V2.5 Sat Aug 7 07:41:59 1993 Doug Lea (dl at g.oswego.edu)
5487  * removed potential for odd address access in prev_chunk
5488  * removed dependency on getpagesize.h
5489  * misc cosmetics and a bit more internal documentation
5490  * anticosmetics: mangled names in macros to evade debugger strangeness
5491  * tested on sparc, hp-700, dec-mips, rs6000
5492  with gcc & native cc (hp, dec only) allowing
5493  Detlefs & Zorn comparison study (in SIGPLAN Notices.)
5494 
5495  Trial version Fri Aug 28 13:14:29 1992 Doug Lea (dl at g.oswego.edu)
5496  * Based loosely on libg++-1.2X malloc. (It retains some of the overall
5497  structure of old version, but most details differ.)
